business.headline: Byju's faces setback as US court upholds $1.2 billion loan default rulingThe court's decision supports an earlier ruling made by the Delaware Court of Chancery, which allowed the company's lenders, represented by Glas Trust LLC, to seize control of Byju's Alpha Inc

JSW Group to shift Rs 40,000 crore EV project from Odisha to Maharashtra: ReportJSW Group, led by Sajjan Jindal, is now eyeing Maharashtra, with Aurangabad and Nagpur emerging as the top contenders for the large-scale EV and battery project.
Manaba Finance IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, expected listing gains The IPO of Manba Finnace is a fresh issue of 1.26 crore shares and closes for subscription on September 25, 2024.

Vodafone Idea shares fall 2% as ICICI Securities cuts target price ICICI Securities has reduced Vodafone Idea's EV/EBITDA multiple to 13 times FY27 from 14 times and lowered its target price to Rs 11 from Rs 15.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Can It supercharge NTPC's stock growth?NTPC's performance in the last two years has largely been driven by its growing renewable energy (RE) business, which is expected to go public in the first half of FY2025.

Gold, silver price today, September 24, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today September 24, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Arkade Developers shares make strong D-Street debut, lists at 37% premiumArkade Developers listing: Shares of the real estate company listed at Rs 175 on the Bombay Exchange (BSE) at a premium of 36.72% over its issue price of Rs 128.

Western Carriers makes weak D-Street debut, lists at 1% discountWestern Carriers market listing: Despite the weak listing, the IPO received strong investor interest, being oversubscribed nearly 31 times, primarily driven by non-institutional investors.

Northern Arc Capital shares list at 33% premium, misses GMP Northern Arc Capital listing: The shares opened at Rs 351, with a premium of 33.5% over the IPO price of Rs 263 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Sensex crosses 85,000 for 1st time, Nifty hits record highAs of 10:05 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had risen 80.74 points to 85,009.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 29.15 points to 25,968.20.

Sensex, Nifty slip from record highs amid rising Middle East tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 107.07 points to 84,821.54 at around 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 23.50 points to trade at 25,915.55.
Sebi fines Anmol Ambani Rs 1 crore for lapses in Reliance Home Finance case Sebi also fined Krishnan Gopalakrishnan, the Chief Risk Officer of Reliance Housing Finance, Rs 15 lakh.
Only 7% of F&O traders made profit in last 3 years, says Sebi studyAccording to the Sebi study, 1.13 crore retail traders in F&O markets collectively lost Rs 1.81 lakh crore during this period.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Key takeaways from DRHP, NTPC share price targetNTPC Green Energy aims to raise Rs 10,000 crore through this public issue, which will consist solely of a fresh issue without any offer-for-sale component.
Sensex ends nearly 400 points higher, Nifty above 25,900The S&P BSE Sensex was down 384.30 points at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 148.10 points to settle at 25,939.05.

X user highlights API flaw in DotPe, removes post after legal noticeAccording to tweets shared by social media users, DotPe's entire API was left public, meaning anyone could access sensitive information without any authentication.
'This is India's moment': Nvidia's Jensen Huang after meeting PM Modi in USNvidia CEO Jensen Huang was one of 15 tech leaders who met with PM Modi during his visit to the United States.

KRN IPO: Key details of Rs 340 crore public issue from Rajasthan farmer's sonThe IPO of KRN Heat Exchanger is the journey of Santosh Kumar Yadav, a farmer's son from Tijara, Rajasthan, from a small town to leading a major manufacturing company.
Should you subscribe Manba Finance IPO: Check GMP, price band, detailsManba Finance IPO: The IPO is fresh issue of 1.26 crore shares and closes for subscription on September 25, 2024.
Is Warren Buffett's cash pile costing him billions in missed gains? Warren Buffett has amassed a cash reserve of about $280 billion after selling shares in companies like Apple and Bank of America.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Court dismisses Siddaramaiah's plea in land scam case: Governor can order probeThe Karnataka High Court on Monday dismissed a petition filed by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, challenging the legality of the Governor's decision to prosecute him over alleged irregularities in the MUDA land scam case.

Badlapur encounter sparks blame game: 'How handcuffed accused opened fire?'The custodial death of the Badlapur sexual assault accused has set the political temperatures soaring in Maharashtra ahead of crucial Assembly elections.

3 rail staffers arrested in Surat over 'sabotage' plot to get felicitatedThree railway trackmen were arrested in Gujarat's Surat district for alleged tampering with tracks and then alerting authorities over a "sabotage attempt" in order to get themselves felicitated.

If I were Vinesh, I would apologise for Olympic disqualification: YogeshwarSpeaking to India Today's sister channel, AajTak, Olympic medalist Yogeshwar Dutt lashed out at Vinesh Phogat for creating false narratives about her Olympic disqualification.

Pragyan rover discovered more than an ancient crater on the MoonThe rover, tasked with exploring the lunar surface, reported an ancient crater close to its landing site, but that was not all that the images revealed.

Israeli strikes kill 492 in Lebanon, Hezbollah fires 200 rockets in retaliationLebanon attacks Israel: The ongoing Israel-Hezbollah conflict has triggered fears of an all-out war in the region since the Gaza conflict erupted on October 7 last year as several countries called for restraint.
Sensex crosses 85,000 for 1st time, Nifty hits record highAs of 10:05 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had risen 80.74 points to 85,009.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 29.15 points to 25,968.20.

Gujarat school principal kills girl for resisting rape, dumps body; arrestedThe principal said that when he tried to rape the girl, she started screaming. He put his hands on her mouth tightly to stop her screaming. However, the girl died, following which he hid her in the back of the car. He took her body and left it inside the school compound in the evening, after the classes were over.

Susan Polgar meets 'amazing Chess Mom' after India's double delightAt the 2024 Chess Olympiad in Hungary, chess legend Susan Polgar had the opportunity to meet and greet Nagalakshmi, the mother of Indian chess stars Praggnanandhaa and Vaishali. Polgar expressed her excitement at meeting the 'amazing chess mom' and posed for a memorable photograph with the family.

Devotee claims tobacco in Tirupati laddu, temple authority says allegation fakeThe woman, a resident of Andhra Pradesh, claimed she found tobacco wrapped in paper inside a laddu that was given to her as prasadam at Sri Venkateswara temple.

Husband of Bengaluru woman found inside fridge suspects lover's role in murderThe estranged husband of the woman, Mahalakshmi, said that she had an illicit relationship with a man, identified as Ashraf, and that he may have been involved in the gruesome murder.

Maharashtra officials inspect EY's Pune office after employee's death EY faces scrutiny over the death of a 26-year-old charter accountant, which has triggered a social media storm and pushed the government to initiate a probe into allegations of a "backbreaking" workload.

Watch: Alia Bhatt makes Paris Fashion Week debut, greets fans with a flying kiss Alai Bhatt made a stunning debut at the Paris Fashion Week on September 23. The actor looked beautiful in a black jumpsuit with metallic silver bustier.

Sunita Williams rescue mission launch faces Tropical Cyclone NineThe mission is being launched with two astronauts and two spare seats for stranded astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Willmore to return in February 025.

Kerala High Court dismisses actor Siddique's bail plea in sexual assault caseAn FIR was filed against Siddique in connection with the sexual assault allegations by an actress in August this year. The case was registered by the Trivandrum Museum Police under the non-bailable offence of rape based on the complaint.

Video: Thane fruit seller urinates in bag, resumes selling without washing handsThe fruit-seller, Ali Khan, continued to sell fruits without washing his hands after urinating inside the plastic bag, a video of which went viral on social media.

Kiran Rao's Laapataa Ladies: 3 scenes that are special to the directorDirector Kiran Rao listed her top three scenes from Laapataa Ladies, which has been announced as India's official entry for the Oscars 2025.

2 Karnataka districts mandate Urdu for anganwadi teachers, BJP lashes outThe controversy stems from an official order from the Department of Women and Child Welfare, which requires applicants in Mudigere, Chikkamagaluru district, to be proficient in Urdu.

PM Modi is 'most pro-American Prime Minister' in India's history: US envoyUS envoy to India Eric Garcetti described PM Modi as "the most pro-American prime minister we've ever seen in Indian history" and praised Biden as "the most pro-Indian president we've had in US history."

R Ashwin responds to Bumrah's 'fittest' remark after after social media stormR Ashwin, speaking in his YouTube show, said it's not fair to compare a fast bowler with a batter as he addressed the furore over Jasprit Bumrah's 'fittest cricketer 'remark. Ashwin said Bumrah is the çrown jewel' of Indian cricket and that the pacer has the right to express his views.

Zeenat Aman got 'stoned' during Dum Maro Dum song: My mother was furiousZeenat Aman shared she smoked chillums while filming 'Dum Maro Dum' in Kathmandu, leaving her high. Her mother was furious at crew members for allowing it.

Badlapur rape accused's mother says son killed as part of 'big conspiracy'Speaking to India Today/Aajtak, Alka Shinde, the mother of the Badlapur rape accused, said that her son was killed as part of a "big conspiracy" and the family will not accept the body until there is an investigation into the entire incident.

Vishy's children are all grown up: Garry Kasparov praises India's Olympiad winFormer world champion Garry Kasparov heaped praise on the Indian contingent after the double gold at the Chess Olympiad. Kasparov claimed that Viswanathan Anand's 'children' had all grown up.

India reports first case of clade 1b mpox: Why this strain is deadlyIndia has reported its first case of the fast-spreading clade 1b mpox variant. This variant, known for its severity, has led the WHO to declare mpox a public health emergency of international concern.

Reality Ranis of the Jungle review: 12 bold beauties battle in the wildReleased-Mon Sep 23, 2024Reality Ranis of The Jungle is a groundbreaking all-women survival show that merges glamour with grit, set in the stunning Himalayan jungles. The show, which premiered on Disney Plus on September 23, featured 12 fearless contestants, led by host Varun Sood, as they battle it out for their survival.

Fabulous Lives vs Bollywood Wives Season 3 to premiere on Netflix in OctoberNetflix has officially announced that the third season of Fabulous Lives vs Bollywood Wives will premiere on October 18, 2024. The new season will feature the return of the original cast along with new faces, such as Riddhima Kapoor Sahni.

Badshah to judge Indian Idol 15 with Shreya Ghoshal, Vishal Dadlani. Watch promoIndian Idol 15 is set to launch soon on Sony TV, with Badshah, Shreya Ghoshal, and Vishal Dadlani as judges. Aditya Narayan will host the show.

Mohun Bagan complete Durand revenge after tense 3-2 win over NorthEast UnitedMohun Bagan Super Giants completed a dramatic 3-2 comeback against NorthEast United in an ISL thriller at Salt Lake Stadium, with Jason Cummings' late strike sealing the win after a controversial equalizer by skipper Shubhashish Bose.

Vishy Anand bumps into Gukesh after Chess OlympiadChess legend Viswanathan Anand shared a humorous moment with young grandmaster D Gukesh at Budapest airport after Gukesh's second Olympiad gold win. Anand, full of praise, sees Gukesh as a future World Championship contender.

Pat Cummins focusing on keeping 'gamechanger' Rishabh Pant quietAustralia Test captain Pat Cummins said that he was focused on Rishabh Pant ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Pant made a sensational Test comeback against Bangladesh and is expected to be crucial in India's success Down Under.

Rishabh Pant vs MS Dhoni, Ashwin-Jadeja role in home dominance Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's stunning Test century against Bangladesh reignited debates about his standing among India's greatest keeper-batters. In the Sledging Room Podcast, experts discussed whether Pant could surpass MS Dhoni as India's top Test wicketkeeper-batter.

Emotional Daniel Ricciardo 'teary-eyed' in potential goodbye from Formula 1Former Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo was emotional after the Singapore GP. The driver was teary-eyed knowing well that the race could have been his final one in Formula One career.

From 'Nanha' to star: How Pro Kabaddi League transformed Narender's lifeIn a small village in Haryana, a young boy nicknamed 'Nanha' spent his days watching older kids practice kabaddi. Little did anyone know that this curious child would one day become one of the sport's rising stars.

In the camp, the management and select players sat down together to discuss the roadmap for cricket in Pakistan.

Maharashtra govt allots Bandra plot unutilised by Sunil Gavaskar to Ajinkya RahaneThe Maharashtra cabinet approved a 30-year lease transfer of a 2,000 sq. meter Bandra plot to cricketer Ajinkya Rahane to develop a sports complex. The land was previously allotted to Sunil Gavaskar, who returned it after decades of non-utilization.

The land was previously allotted to Sunil Gavaskar, who returned it after decades of non-utilization.

R Ashwin reveals Virat Kohli's surprise after seeing Chennai Test crowd on Day 1Ravichandran Ashwin revealed that Virat Kohli was surprised seeing the turnout of the Chennai crowd on the morning of Day 1 of the 1st Test between India and Bangladesh. However, the crowd later turned up in big numbers to support the Indian team.

Ashwin recalls age banter with Rohit Sharma after wife's hilarious questionIndia spinner R Ashwin shared a humorous exchange with Rohit Sharma about their age during India's dominant Test win over Bangladesh. Ashwin's stellar all-round performance led India to a 280-run victory, earning him consecutive Player of the Match awards.

Coach Gautam Gambhir is a 'relaxed rancho', everybody will love him: R AshwinIndia vs Bangladesh: Speaking after his all-round heroics in the Chennai Test, off-spinner R Ashwin highlighted the difference between 'relaxed' Gautam Gambhir and 'organised' Rahul Dravid. Gambhir tasted success in his first Test assignment as head coach on Sunday.

More wins than loses: Tracing India's incredible Test cricket journeyNinety-two years after CK Nayudu's men played India's first Test against England at Lord's in 1932, Rohit Sharma's team achieved a historic milestone. With their victory over Bangladesh in Chennai, India now has more wins than losses in Test cricket for the first time. Let's dive into India's journey in Test cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
